question: What are the main reasons for the project delay in the Khurja-Dadri Section Contract Package 302?
ground_truth: The main reasons for the project delay in the Khurja-Dadri Section Contract Package 302 include insufficient deployment of manpower by GIL-TPL JV, with major important posts yet to be filled, and the delay in utility shifting work due to lack of approvals from stakeholders. Additionally, there is a lack of proper emphasis on adequate resources mobilization.

question: What are the main issues affecting the progress of work in the Khurja-Dadri Section project?
ground_truth: The main issues affecting the progress of work in the Khurja-Dadri Section project are: 1) The design and drawings are technically incomplete. 2) It takes a long time to resubmit drawings incorporating the Engineer's comments, and no comprehensive Design & Drawing schedule is prepared to meet the deadline. 3) Inadequate planning, such as missing breakdown of activities, for example, the work of chartered utilities (Civil) was to be started from 7th Jan, 2017, but no dedicated plan is generated even after 10 months. 4) Work on Electrical utilities was to be started on 14th July, 2016, but it is not allocated to any specialized agency even after 10 months. 5) Key level personnel as specified in CA are yet to be mobilized, and strengthening of resources at crew level requires significant efforts. 6) No borrow area permission is available with the Contractor to execute the embankment work.

Subject: Progress of Work

Dear Sir,

This is to bring to the attention of GIL-TPL (JV) that the progress of work is extremely slow, due to in adequate both in terms of machinery & manpower.

The main issues are as follows:-

The design and drawings are technically incomplete.

It takes long time to resubmit drawings in incorporating on Engineer's comments. Till date, no comprehensive Design & Drawing schedule is prepared to meet the dead line. In progress review meeting, adhoc commitments to submit the drawings & documents are being agreed and subsequently these are never adhered to.

Inadequate planning i.e. breakdown of activities are missing. For example work of chartered utilities (Civil) was to be started from 7" Jan, 2017, but even after 10 months, no dedicated plan is generated to perform this job. Shifting of 1R quarter, the revised relocation plan for Dankaur has been submitted for approval only recently. For others locations (Khurja & Sikandarpur), no such plans are submitted.

Work on Electrical utilities was to be started on 14" July, 2016 but this special work is not even allocated to any specialized agency i.e. even after 10 months. As it is already pointed out in the meeting on date 07/04/17, key level personnel as specified in CA are yet to be mobilized. Strengthening of resources at crew level also requires significant efforts.

No borrow area permission is available with Contractor to execute the

embankment work. Borrow area pan must be prepared to match the monthly targets.

We need an immediate response to all above points.

Best Regards,

Acting\TL of PMC

question: What specific actions did the Contractor take to extend the supplied resources for precommissioning works, in response to the Subcontractor's failure to mobilize and fulfill its contractual obligations?
ground_truth: The Contractor extended the injected Compressor and manpower for precommissioning works, with the relevant cost detailed, and notified the Subcontractor that these amounts would be recovered from the Subcontractor under the Subcontract notification.

Subject: Response to Subcontractor’s Letter on Final Close-Out Proposal Disagreement

Reference: TWE-PCS-L-1007-00227 dated 3 December 2024

Dear Sir,

Subcontractor has, in its recent letter,1 disagreed with Contractor's final close-out proposal.

1. Under the Settlement Agreement,2 Contractor made substantial financial concessions to Subcontractor amounting to USD 12.7 million, including:

a) An additional cash payment of USD 5.7 million to Subcontractor; and

b) A waiver of back charges amounting to USD 7 million, which had previously been imposed due to Subcontractor's demonstrated shortcomings in manpower provision and overall project performance as recorded in Project Correspondences.

In consideration of these concessions, Subcontractor unequivocally agreed to complete all balance works under the Subcontract mobilizing its own resources, allowing Contractor to withdraw previously injected resources to cease any further additional cost; this was at the heart of the Agreement, and provided Subcontractor an opportunity to address prior deficiencies and fulfill its outstanding contractual obligations in a timely and efficient manner.

It is a matter of fact that Subcontractor has failed to honour its commitments, and has exhibited a lack of effort and diligence to inject additional resources to attend all scope, in contravention of the principles of good faith embedded in the Agreement. Subcontractor's continued underperformance necessitated substantial remedial action by Contractor to keep previously injected resources on part of Subcontractor’s scope, at additional unforeseen costs to it, including maintaining additional injected manpower and equipment (post settlement agreement) to complete the balance works that Subcontractor was obligated to perform.

2. Contractor disagrees with Subcontractor’s assertion that "Contractor intentionally delayed the finalization of SA1 to account for its own delay in providing the necessary work front", since facts on record demonstrate that it was Subcontractor who caused the delays.

Subcontractor’s persistent refusal to aline its schedule with the Project requirements directly delayed in finalizing SA1; notwithstanding this, Contractor sent the draft SA1 with

3. Subcontractor’s statement that ‘Subcontractor completed the Subcontract Works (balance scope post the descope by the Contractor) substantially by October 2022, in compliance with SA1 extension” in December 2022 due to Contractor’s intervention, which Subcontractor has failed to admit. Contractor refutes Subcontractor’s assertion that the back charges pertain to issues predating the effective date of SA1. They correspond to costs incurred after the effective date of SA1, and Contractor has, in fact, waived a substantial portion of incurred costs, which is until 30 April 2022. The costs incurred thereafter due to Subcontractor’s failure to fulfill its contractual obligations devolve solely on Subcontractor. Contractor’s letters PCS- TWE-L-1007-00298 and 00345 dated 25 April 2022 and 1 August 2022 respectively demonstrate the factual and contractual basis of its claims.

4. Subcontractor’s contention that “The SA1 was executed on 12 November 2022, and up until that date, the Contractor did not raise any claims regarding additional back charges incurred after affective date’ is false. question: What issues slow GIL-TPL JV's Khurja-Dadri project?
ground_truth: The issues slowing GIL-TPL JV's Khurja-Dadri project include: 1) Delay in submission of revised drawings for 10km from CH: 1394 to 1404, 2) Unapproved alignment drawings for CH: 1404 to 1413.856, 3) Designs of four major bridges not yet submitted, 4) Lack of progress on availability of sufficient Borrow areas, 5) Delay in Test Pile design submission by more than six months, 6) No satisfactory action on utility shifting, and 7) Site approval for quarters not processed.

question: What personnel gaps and utility issues are delaying the Khurja-Dadri railway project?
ground_truth: The personnel gaps delaying the Khurja-Dadri railway project include insufficient deployment of manpower by GIL-TPL JV, with major important posts yet to be filled such as CPM, Planning Engineer, Chief Design Engineer, Contract Manager, Railway Track Expert, Alignment Expert, and SHE Expert. The utility issues include the delay in utility shifting work despite no land problem, with civil and electrical utility drawings submitted by the contractor being returned back, and the need for approvals from stakeholders to be initiated immediately.

question: How do missed notification timelines and SCF execution affect a contractor's compensation claim in mech works?
ground_truth: Missed notification timelines affect a contractor's compensation claim because if the Contractor fails to notify within 28 days after the event, they shall not be entitled to any additional payment, and the company shall be discharged from all liability in connection with the claim. SCF execution does not affect the compensation claim as the company issued all instructions and SCFs appropriately, and there was no delay or acceleration by the Contractor as alleged.
contexts:
Date Our Ref. No. Your Ref. No.

: 08 December 2024 : PCI 10001007161 : STS/PRP00140/ 004/2024a

Required Reply

: No

Special Technical Services LLC P.O. Box 307, PC-118 Al-Harthy Complex Muscat, Sultanate of Oman

Attention: Mr. Jayasankar M, GM TA&M

Contract: Contract No.4600007104 Call-Off Contract for Main Mechanical Works during

Turnaround for Downstream Assets

Subject: Contractor Purported Acceleration

OQ refers to the Contract No.4600007104 Call-Off Contract for Main Mechanical Works during Turnaround for Downstream Assets, and related Call-Off Orders issued pertaining to mechanical works for Turn Around (TA) at Sohar Refinery (SR1) & Polypropylene Plant (PP), and the Contractor’s Reference Letter No. STS/PRP00140/ 004/2024a dated 21 October 2024.

As per Clause 44.1 in C3 of the Contract, if the Contractor considers itself to be entitled to any adjustment to the Contract Price, the Contractor shall submit a notice as soon as practicable and, in any event, not later than twenty-eight (28) days after the event or circumstance giving rise to the claim. On 21 October 2024, almost eleven (11) months later after the events stated in the section D and E of the Contractor’s reference letter, the Contractor asserted that they believe in that they are entitled to compensation for their purported acceleration to mitigate so-called OQ’s delays. The Contractor failed to notify within 28 days after the event and the Contractor shall not be entitled to any additional payment and OQ shall be discharged from all liability in connection with the claim in accordance with Clause 44.2 in C3 of the Contract. Therefore, the Contractor’s claim for additional payment for acceleration is rejected.

Without prejudice to above, the Company would like to provide their comments to the events stated in Section E of the Contractor’s letter in the same sequence. However, The Company does not intend to respond each and every statement or allegation in the Contractor’s reference letter. Company’s failure to respond or address any other statement or allegation in referenced correspondence shall not be deemed, implied or construed as its agreement or admission by the Company of the veracity, relevance or acceptance, of such statement or allegation, and the Company reserves its right to respond thereto at a later date and at or in the appropriate forum.

1. Late Issuance of Call-Off Order related to the Scope Change Form (“SCF”) SCF means “any scope discovered during TA execution and after equipment opening”. The Company has a right to instruct the Contractor to execute SCF or any additional work authorized by OQ TA Manager during TA Execution, in accordance with clause 39 of C3 and section 6 of C4 of the Contract.

Page 1 of 4

The Contractor is required to prepare and submit the costing of SCF, and all changes are to be documented through an approved SCF which shall then be followed by an approved Call-Off Order in accordance with Sections 6.1.1.3 and 6.1.2.1 of C4 of the Contract.

The Company has issued all instructions and SCF’s in an appropriate manner for the Contractor to progress with the works. Therefore, there was neither a delay arising out of this process nor any acceleration by the Contractor as alleged.

2. Delayed Handover of RFCC This issue was in the Contractor’s idle time claim and repeated here. It was duly addressed by the Company in its relevant letters. The Company notes a contradiction in the Contractor’s assertion that it kept 2,160 man idle over a full duration of seven days with no mitigation in the Contractor’s idle time claim, while also asserting that the Contractor accommodated the seven-day impact in its acceleration claim. 3 and 4. Late Material Availability & Pre-TA Progress Company’s records indicate that all materials listed in the original MTO were delivered between February and October 2023. The Company reminds that it was the Contractor’s responsibility to validate and verify the original MTO to identify any possible missing materials and report to OQ at least four months prior to TA execution. The Contractor delayed MTO validation by one month. The Company took immediate actions to order missing materials in the original MTO and additional materials requested to reduce the field joints. Therefore, the Contractor’s alleged delayed materials in its reference letter should be the materials which was delayed due to Contractor’s own MTO validation delay.

While the Contractor reported general concerns regarding

ground_truth: The delay in design plans affects the Khurja-Dadri construction timeline as construction activities cannot start until the designs are approved. Despite land availability issues being solved, there are activities that could be undertaken but are not being done due to the delay in design submissions. The delay in the design phase is likely to cause further delays in the project.

question: What unresolved issues might extend the Khurja-Dadri project delay?
ground_truth: Unresolved issues that might extend the Khurja-Dadri project delay include insufficient deployment of manpower by GIL-TPL JV, with major important posts yet to be filled, and the delay in utility shifting due to the need for approvals from stakeholders and obtaining NOC from various stakeholders.

e The first milestone of 10% booking is approaching fast i.e. June 2017. If no action is taken now it is likely that this Milestone may be missed. It is advised to submit the plan immediately.

© The progress of the project is being closely monitored at fortnightly/weekly but desired results are not getting achieved primarily due to repeated failure.

© Insufficient deployment of Manpower by GIL-TPL JV. Major important posts are yet to be filled by GIL- TPL JV. No CV has been received during last one month. Key personal such as CPM, Chief Design Engineer, Contract Manager, railway Track Expert, Alignment Expert, SHE expert are vacant. This is indicative of lack of involvement of GIL-TPL JV in this project. This deficiency may also be cause of delay in project as well as Quality issues. This issue must be taken up with GIL-TPL JV on top priority.

e Utility Shifting: Civil & Electrical Utility Drawings submitted by the contractor and were returned back. The work of utility shifting is already delayed badly in spite of no land problem involved. Approvals from stakeholders need to be initiated immediately. Action plan for obtaining NOC from various stakeholders is essentially required for starting the utility shifting work.
